definition: to bet/to make a bet/a wager
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Jacob wagered his donkey, he did not bet his ass.
sentences.chinese: 雅各布担保了他的驴子，他并没有打赌他的屁股。

sentences.english: I bet Sean Avery has an opinion on this..
sentences.chinese: 我打赌肖恩艾弗里对这件事会有看法。

sentences.english: Speculators, betting that the yuan will appreciate, are buying it with weakening greenbacks.
sentences.chinese: 打赌人民币升值的投机者用疲软的美元购买人民币。

sentences.english: I bet he had a hand in the kidnapping.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打赌，这件绑架案他肯定参与了。

sentences.english: He was certainly on pins and needles - I'll bet this is the first time his wife has ever had a baby.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打赌，这肯定是他太太第一次生孩子。

sentences.english: I'm willing to bet that's perhaps a similar picture [to what] we're seeing here, " said Sobel, whose study will be published tomorrow in the journal
sentences.chinese: 我敢打赌我们可以看到类似的画面。

sentences.english: I betcha a lot of people drink and drive too.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打赌一定有很多人也边开车边喝酒。

sentences.english: Today, I lost a bet with my brother and had to kiss his butt.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我和我弟弟打赌输了，我得去亲他的屁股。

sentences.english: I bet neither one of them got the girl.
sentences.chinese: 我敢打赌，他们谁也没得到那个女孩。

sentences.english: She is very beautiful, I bet this is the most beautiful in the world chameleon.
sentences.chinese: 她真漂亮，我敢打赌，这是全世界最漂亮的变色龙。
印度女人们打赌用姜黄就能解决。

sentences.english: He bet me $200 that his horse would come in first.
sentences.chinese: 他拿200美元与我打赌说他的马会第一个进来。

sentences.english: If you love puzzle-solving, I bet you will love Infernal Affairs.
sentences.chinese: 如果你爱益智解题，我打赌你会爱上无间道。

sentences.english: I bet 10-15 years from now, these fools will shut up.
sentences.chinese: 我打赌15年后，这些蠢蛋就会闭嘴。

sentences.english: A9:Oh, I bet you say that to all your Apple products.
sentences.chinese: 喔，我打赌你对你所有的苹果产品都怎么说。

definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
stake (in a gamble)/(what is at) stake
see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
